snippet: Perhaps too much emphasis is placed on looking for existing breast cancer when the search should focus on prevention and the possibility of finding a vaccine.
abstract: Dr Susan Love essay examines the limitations of routine mammography screening as a method for combating breast cancer; contends that breast cancer advocacy must move beyond screening for cancers that are already there, even beyond the cure, to finding the cause.
lead_paragraph: Perhaps too much emphasis is placed on looking for existing breast cancer when the search should focus on prevention and the possibility of finding a vaccine.

headline.seo: Breast Cancer Screening Matters, but Prevention Is the Real Goal
headline.main: Real Race in Cancer Is Finding Its Cause
headline.print_headline: Real Race In Cancer Is Finding Its Cause

keywords.value: Komen, Susan G, for the Cure
keywords.name: organizations
